page.title: 09HOUSING IN SANDHEAD
page.content: by John McLean aged 12 In Sandhead there are three different kinds of houses. Their are the original old stone- built houses, some younger houses built in the fifties, and in the last three years there have been a lot of new houses built in Sandhead. These are the first houses to be built in the village since the end of the last war. There is a Creamery house and next to it there is the old Creamery. There have been new bungalows built in the area of the Creamery. A lot of old people live in the houses in Sandhead Village. There is a Church in Sandhead and the Manse was built in 1975. Next to the old school, which is now a house, new bungalows have been built. Most houses have been built by the Council and some people have bought them so they don't have to pay rent.
